summary: An FBI email from the New York VCAC/Human Trafficking unit discussing investigative findings regarding Ghislaine Maxwell's cell phone number. It details how the number was identified, its association with a UPS store address in Boston, its connection to Maxwell's company Terramar Project, Inc., and its presence in Jeffrey Epstein's phone seized at his arrest.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The central subject of the email. Her cell phone number was identified and linked to a UPS store address in Boston and her company Terramar Project, Inc. Her number was found in Jeffrey Epstein's phone.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned in relation to his arrest. His seized cell phone contained Ghislaine Maxwell's contact information, listed under the names 'Ghislaine' with labels 'Mobile', 'Home', and 'Work'.

connections.description: Maxwell's phone numbers (Mobile, Home, Work) were stored in Epstein's cell phone, indicating direct contact and association.

events.title: Epstein's Arrest
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was arrested. His cell phone was seized on this day.

events.title: Attempted Contact with Maxwell
events.description: The day after Epstein's arrest, the identified phone number for Ghislaine Maxwell was called in an attempt to make contact with her.

locations: UPS store (associated with the Boston address)
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's cell phone number was associated with a UPS store address in Boston, Massachusetts.
Subscriber information for the number traced back to 'Terramar Project, Inc.', a company owned by Maxwell.
Jeffrey Epstein's cell phone, seized on the day of his arrest, contained Maxwell's number listed under the name 'Ghislaine' with labels 'Mobile', 'Home', and 'Work'.
The day after Epstein's arrest, this number was called in an attempt to contact Maxwell, after which her attorney contacted the agents.
The document is an FBI email from the New York VCAC/Human Trafficking unit, indicating an active investigation into Maxwell following Epstein's arrest.
